How Much Does Printer Rental Cost? A Complete Guide for Businesses

July 1, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Printers play a vital role in any business—whether for documents, reports, or client proposals. But for many companies, buying a printer outright isn't always the most practical choice. That’s why printer rental has become a popular alternative. If you're considering this option, one of the first questions that comes to mind is: How much does printer rental cost?

In this guide, we’ll walk you through everything you need to know about printer rental pricing—what factors affect it, what’s included in the agreement, and how to choose the best rental plan for your needs.

What Is Printer Rental?

Before diving into costs, let’s define what printer rental is.

Printer rental is a service that allows businesses to lease printers and multifunction copiers instead of purchasing them. This option often includes maintenance, support, and consumables such as toner, making it an all-in-one printing solution.

To learn more about the concept, check out What Is Printer Rental?

So, How Much Does Printer Rental Cost?

The cost of printer rental depends on several key factors. However, to give you a ballpark figure:

  • Basic printers (ideal for small offices): ₱1,000 to ₱2,500 per month

  • Mid-range multifunction printers (MFPs): ₱2,500 to ₱5,000 per month

  • High-volume or production printers: ₱6,000 to ₱15,000+ per month

These are just averages. The actual price may vary based on usage, brand, features, and contract length. If you want a closer look at updated rates, visit How Much Does Printer Rental Cost?

What Affects the Cost of Printer Rental?

Several factors determine how much you'll pay for a printer rental:

1. Printer Type and Features

The more advanced the printer, the higher the rental price. For example:

  • Inkjet vs. Laser Printers

  • Black-and-white vs. Color Printing

  • Basic Print-Only vs. Multifunction (print, scan, copy, fax)

  • Paper capacity and finishing features (e.g., staplers, sorters)

You can explore What Types of Printers Can I Rent? to compare your options.

2. Print Volume and Usage

If your office prints a lot, you may be charged a per-page fee (also called cost-per-click) in addition to the base rental. This model ensures that you only pay for what you use.

3. Contract Duration

Rental terms typically range from monthly to multi-year contracts. Generally, the longer your rental term, the lower the monthly cost. Learn more at How Long Can I Rent a Printer For?

4. Inclusions in the Rental Plan

Some providers offer all-in rental packages—which include preventive maintenance, repairs, consumables (toner and drum), and even replacement units if needed. These packages may cost more upfront but save you from surprise expenses later.

Find out What Is Included in a Printer Rental Agreement? before signing a deal.

Hidden Costs to Watch Out For

While many providers are transparent, you should still check for:

  • Installation and delivery fees

  • Early termination charges

  • Overage fees for exceeding monthly print volume

  • Consumables not included in cheaper plans

Always ask for a full breakdown before committing.

Printer Rental vs. Buying: Which Is More Cost-Effective?

If you're wondering whether to rent or buy, here's a quick comparison:

FactorBuyingRenting
Upfront CostHighLow or none
MaintenancePaid separatelyOften included
FlexibilityLowHigh
Risk of ObsolescenceHighLow
Cost ControlVariablePredictable

In most cases, printer rental is ideal for companies that want flexibility, predictable budgeting, and zero worries about repairs.

When Does Printer Rental Make Sense?

Printer rental is especially beneficial for:

  • Startups and SMEs with limited capital

  • Project-based teams with short-term needs

  • Growing companies that don’t want to commit to outdated machines

  • Businesses needing reliable service and support

Tips to Get the Best Printer Rental Deal

  1. Assess your needs: Know your monthly volume, color vs. black-and-white needs, and functions (e.g., scan, fax).

  2. Ask for a demo or trial: Some providers offer free trial periods.

  3. Bundle services: Renting multiple units or adding scanners/copiers may give you a better rate.

  4. Compare providers: Don’t settle for the first quote—compare features, support, and total value.

Final Thoughts

So, how much does printer rental cost? It depends—but understanding your needs and the factors that influence pricing can help you find a cost-effective solution that works for your business.

Printer rental is more than just a cost-saving strategy; it’s a smarter, scalable way to manage your office printing needs without long-term commitment or financial strain.

To learn more or request a personalized quote, visit the official printer rental guide at Marga Enterprises.

Key Takeaways:

  • Printer rental costs range from ₱1,000 to ₱15,000+ per month.

  • Pricing depends on printer type, usage, contract length, and included services.

  • All-in rental packages offer the best value for long-term savings and convenience.

  • Renting is ideal for businesses seeking flexibility, cost control, and reliability.
